channel.title: Problem with my scrolling
channel.description:
Well, i'm no tech-wiz so I have no idea what's wrong. I recently came on to my computer to discover the icons were all enlarged, so after restoring them to their previous size I then noticed while scrolling on websites, the scrolling animation is quite choppy, as in you can see the previous frame fly up the page and the new one replace it. It is happening on both Google Chrome and Internet explorer, so I doubt it has anything to do with my browser..
Does anybody have an idea of how to fix this?

item.title: Problem with my scrolling
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:6, topic:429138”]I know in internet explorer there is an option in the advanced tab for “smooth scrolling” see if chrome has something like that.

Also, did you do anything with your video driver? Go to your driver panel and see if there is a yellow question mark showing at the video driver.[/quote]

I found out my video driver was severely outdated there and had to update it. Seems to be working fine now, cheers for the help!

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with my scrolling
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:5, topic:429138”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=531833.msg3886435#msg3886435 date=1326487325]

No it’s nothing to do with my mouse, it’s the actual screen movement when scrolling up/down. It is just very choppy and ‘lagged’, no smoothness whatsoever.
[/quote]what type of pages are you viewing? Normally page choppiness occurs when your using a lot of cpu memory on one page. (for example a site with a lot of images/adobe players/etc)

How many tabs do you have open?

Is your process for chrome or whatever set to a high priority?

No settings were changed by me for Chrome and I doubt it was anybody else in my family as I’m the only one who actually uses Chrome. 3 tabs are open but that shouldn’t cause any such lag as far as I know anyway. and CPU seems to be normal also.[/quote]

I know in internet explorer there is an option in the advanced tab for “smooth scrolling” see if chrome has something like that.

Also, did you do anything with your video driver? Go to your driver panel and see if there is a yellow question mark showing at the video driver.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with my scrolling
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:4, topic:429138”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=531833.msg3886432#msg3886432 date=1326487165]
No it’s nothing to do with my mouse, it’s the actual screen movement when scrolling up/down. It is just very choppy and ‘lagged’, no smoothness whatsoever.
[/quote]what type of pages are you viewing? Normally page choppiness occurs when your using a lot of cpu memory on one page. (for example a site with a lot of images/adobe players/etc)

How many tabs do you have open?

Is your process for chrome or whatever set to a high priority?[/quote]

No settings were changed by me for Chrome and I doubt it was anybody else in my family as I’m the only one who actually uses Chrome. 3 tabs are open but that shouldn’t cause any such lag as far as I know anyway. and CPU seems to be normal also.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with my scrolling
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

You mean your mouse is showing several steps behind it after you move it? Go into your mouse properties in control panel. There should be something labeled something like “pointer options” you can also moderate mouse speed in here

Read full topic
